definition: heddle (device to form warp in weaving textiles)/Taiwan pr. [zong4]
to sum up/to put together/Taiwan pr. [zong4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Later she went to work for China Central Television Station, presenting two variety shows.
sentences.chinese: 接着她又在中央电视台工作，主持两档综艺节目。

sentences.english: Joe wants to be a variety show host.
sentences.chinese: 乔想做综艺节目的主持人。

sentences.english: She often watches variety show to alleviate pressure.
sentences.chinese: 她经常通过看综艺节目来减轻压力。

sentences.english: I prefer a variety show without a host .
sentences.chinese: 我更喜欢没有主持人的综艺节目。

sentences.english: Do you want to enjoy the priority in getting tickets to shows where DYT will appear?
sentences.chinese: 想优先得到有戴阳天出席的综艺节目票吗？

sentences.english: There is a great variety-show on CCTV at 8.
sentences.chinese: 中央电视台8点有很棒的综艺节目。

sentences.english: Joe want to be a variety show host…
sentences.chinese: 乔想做综艺节目的主持人。

sentences.english: Grasshoppers singing their song Ban Dian Xing on a Singapore variety programme many years ago.
sentences.chinese: 草蜢多年前在新加坡综艺节目上演唱歌曲《半点星》。

definition: online variety show (contracted form of 網絡綜藝節目|网络综艺节目)
satellite TV (abbr. for 衛星電視|卫星电视[wei4 xing1 dian4 shi4])
to broadcast/to air (a TV program etc)
The Voice of China, PRC reality talent show
abbr. for 春節聯歡晚會|春节联欢晚会[Chun1 jie2 Lian2 huan1 Wan3 hui4]
(neologism c. 2014) celebrity with a huge, devoted fan base/celebrity with a huge following on social media
